intro: Navarretia viscidula var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescence of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, glandular leaves that give it a sticky appearance, and it produces slender, elongated seed pods. Navarretia viscidula var. purpurea is an annual plant that blooms in the spring and is often found in disturbed soils.
